meanings.definition: It is necessary or proper for someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: It behooves us to study for the exam.
meanings.sent2: It always behooves a student to pay attention in class.
meanings.sent3: It behooves the cat to chase after the laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: In life, it behooves us to learn from our mistakes.
meanings.sent5: It truly behooves a chef to taste their own cooking before serving it.

meanings.definition: It is appropriate or advantageous for someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: Wearing a raincoat behooves you on a rainy day.
meanings.sent2: It is always behooves to be polite to others.
meanings.sent3: It behooves a clown to wear a red nose and big shoes.
meanings.sent4: In negotiations, it behooves the stronger party to be fair.
meanings.sent5: It truly behooves a detective to pay attention to small details.
